intro: Cacalia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are densely packed, giving the plant its common name. Cacalia densiflora is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
